title: The National Solid Waste Management Act
title_en: The National Solid Waste Management Act

provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the National Solid Waste
Management (Public Cleanliness) Regulations, 2003.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. A notice offering the discharge of any liability to conviction of an
offence to which section 53(2) of the Act applies by payment of a fixed
penalty (hereinafter referred to as a "fixed penalty notice") shall be in the F L S ~
                                                                              Schedule
form set out as Form 1 in the First Schedule.                                 Form 1.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3.-(1) An authorized officer may, pursuant to section 53 of the Act,
require any person served with a fixed penalty notice to state his name and
address and produce proof of identity for inspection.
        (2) A person who fails to comply with a requirement made under
paragraph (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction before
a Resident Magistrate to a fine not exceeding fifty thousand dollars.
         (3) An authorized officer may arrest a person who, without
reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement made under paragraph
(1) and forthwith take the person before a police officer or to the nearest
police station.
         (4) Where a fixed penalty notice is served on any person, the
Authority may, at any time before the commencement of proceedings against
that person in respect of the offence specified in the notice and, whether or
not an order has been applied for but before such order has been made,
withdraw the notice.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. A certificate under section 53(5) of the Act that payment of a fixed
penalty was or was not made to the Authority or to a body designated under
section 53(4) of the Act by a date specified in the certificate shall be in the
form set out as Form 2 in the First Schedule.                                     Form 2.
